subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Friday, 22 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Striker Henry 'joins Barcelona'
Barcelona are set to sign Arsenal striker Thierry Henry for a fee believed to be about £16m, according to reports coming out of Spain.



 
O'Connor to join Birmingham City
Birmingham agree to sign Scotland striker Garry O'Connor for £2.65m from Lokomotiv Moscow.



 
Boro sign Turkey striker Tuncay
Middlesbrough sign Turkey striker Tuncay Sanli on a four-year deal.








GOLF




BMW International leaderboard
England's Nick Spieherty starts his second round at the European Tour's BMW International Open in Munich.



 
Former winner Duval out of Open
David Duval withdraws from next month's Open at Carnoustie for family reasons.



 
Travelers Ch'ship leaderboard
Leading scores from the PGA tournament.








MOTORSPORT




Ferrari wait for 'real Raikkonen'
Ferrari president Luca di Montezemolo says they are still waiting for Kimi Raikkonen to produce his best form.



 
Pedrosa targets Donington victory
Britain-based Spaniard Dani Pedrosa says 'a win is coming soon' ahead of this weekend's British MotoGP.



 
Briton Smith cool in GP spotlight
Teenage British 125cc rider Bradley Smith says he will not feel any extra pressure at Donington this weekend.








FORMULA ONE




Ferrari wait for 'real Raikkonen'
Ferrari president Luca di Montezemolo says they are still waiting for Kimi Raikkonen to produce his best form.



 
Hamilton - I can hold off Alonso
Lewis Hamilton believes he has a competitive edge over Fernando Alonso that could see him crowned F1 champion.



 
Ferrari 'can regain early form'
Ferrari president Luca di Montezemolo claims there is little to choose between his team and McLaren despite their big lead in the F1 standings.








ATHLETICS




Injured Tomlinson out of Euro Cup
Long jumper Chris Tomlinson will miss the European Cup in Munich this weekend after failing a fitness test.



 
Pickering leads GB's Euro hopes
Sprinter Craig Pickering aims to inspire Great Britain's men's team to another European Cup win in Munich this weekend.



 
Greene pulls out of European Cup
An ankle injury forces Welshman David Greene to withdraw from the Great Britain team for this weekend's European Cup.








CYCLING




British pair close on Tour spot
British riders Mark Cavendish and Roger Hammond are named in T-Mobile's initial squad of 13 riders for the Tour de France.



 
Cavendish backs anti-doping drive
Britain's Mark Cavendish signs the International Cycling Union's new anti-doping charter.



 
T-Mobile sack Ukrainian Honchar
Serhiy Honchar is sacked by his T-Mobile team for violating their code of conduct.








FUN AND GAMES




Dutch courage
Robbo has the answer to why England never win penalty shoot-outs



 
Ten to Tackle
How much can you remember about the past week's sport?



 
Angel delight
Robbo on why it cheers him to see out-of-shape sportsmen winning trophies
